a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:30): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: No

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:30): 70km or so, I'd guess
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:31): has to do 6502 Assembly for a practical computing assessment

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (16:31): google maps says 83

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (16:32): that must be an incredibly slow bus, travelling at an average speed less than 50km/h
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:33): The route it takes is unusually sane for a bus around here
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (16:33): hmm, I guess it's passing through a fair few towns on the way, which would slow it down
150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64 (16:33): average speed of less than 50km for a bus in a city is not "incredibly slow"
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:33): A lot of towns.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:34): 150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64: This is certainly not a city whatsoever.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (16:35): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, is the maximum speed limit for a bus there about 100km/h, outside of towns?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:35): I think it is 60mph, so yeah.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (16:35): like on highways, etc.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:35): 100 is 62.3km/h
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (16:35): wtf? You measure in miles there?!
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:35): Oh sure.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (16:35): why? I though only the US was backwards enough to be using miles
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:35): We also measure fuel economy in miles per gallon (imperial gallons, not US gallons), and buy petrol in litres.
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (16:36): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: i believe the highway speed limit is 60 or 65mph
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (16:36): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: and i wouldn't plan on relying on buses/public transport
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:36): 47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8: We aren't talking about CA
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:36): 47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8: We're talking about somewhere more awesome. :D
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (16:36): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: oh?
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (16:36): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: not hard

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:37): 47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8: Unless you want to find my house in CA :D

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (16:39): d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631, the fact that they aren't metric, and doing maths with them is hard

47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (16:39): night all
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:39): Hm, Google Maps says only 16 hours and 18 minutes on foot.

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (16:40): d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631, try making sense out of why there's 12 inches/foot, 3 feet/yard, and 1760 yards/mile, or 5280 feet/mile. There's just no logic there.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:40): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: You actually know that? I don't.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (16:41): (and I had to look those last 2 values up, cause I've got no hope of remembering them)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (16:41): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, what's the difference between imperial and US gallons?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:42): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: They are a different amount.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:42): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: More detailed than that, I don't know and don't care.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:42): (I have software to convert it to litres, so I don't care.)
d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631 (16:43): wonders when in real life f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 needed to know how many feet where in a mile
d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631 (16:43): lives in Ireland, on one side of the border we measure in miles, on the other, km
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:44): ought to go to Ireland some time

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (16:44): d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631, luckily, I come from a sensible country that uses the metric system, so I don't need to know. But I might need to when I go to the US
